page.title: 20MEDIA
page.content: Most people have colour TV & reception is generally good in the centre of the village but bad elsewhere even with the use of signal boosters. Reception of radio 4 is good but VHF varies from fair to very bad even with a large outside aerial. We were told the new TV mast at Cemmaes would improve reception but this has not been so. 30 copies of the Welsh paper "Blewyn Glas are sold in the village. Shop sales are 16 Liverpool Post (Welsh edition) 2 Guardian, 3 Sun, 3 Mail, 6 Express, 2 Telegraph, 1 Mirror & 0 Cambrian news. There are weekly sales of 10 Radio Times, 9 TV Times, 30 County Times & 14 Women's magazines.
